Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
literally: to reach; hence: = process by which a certain event reaches the time for it to take place
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which objects move back into the direction they came from
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= water that has fallen as rain

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which (part of) the body of humans shakes or trembles violently and involuntarily, ◄ caused by fear, respect, or old age

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state in which someone is no longer engaged in an action one used to be engaged in previously
= causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task
literally: eyes are darkened; hence: = state in which the human eye can no longer see very well

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= opening in a wall
= causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a door (דֶּלֶת)
= something that provides or prevents access ◄ as if it were a door
= the action of stones of a hand mill or a larger mill crushing grain into flour; ≈ an essential, daily activity
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten
literally: daughters of song; hence, possibly: = birds (צִפֹּור) that produces musical songs; alternatively: = the act of producing musical sounds

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= event that causes people to lose their inner strength and courage

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= process by which plants to produce flowers

= a tree belonging to the peach family; growing wild, and reaching a height of 4.5 to 6 m; it sheds its oblong leaves in winter and produces white or pink flowers and blooms as early as January; the leaves appear much later; ◄ Prunis dulcis; ► the seed is fifty percent oil, and can be eaten raw or roasted

= type of migratory locust; consumes all vegetation; ◄ swarming creature with wings; ► clean animal which may be eaten; ≈ regarded as a small but destructive insect; its way of walking resembles that of an old man

= plant with heavy, drooping branches; blooms in May and its large white flowers are open for only one night; ◄ Capparis Spinosa; ► its buds are pickled in vinegar and eaten as a condiment with meat; both fruit and buds are supposed to stimulate appetite; ≈ the eating of the fruit of this plant was believed to stimulate one's sexual desire
literally: to go; hence: = process by which living creatures live their life until the moment of death
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans move through a certain place, though not always in a straight line but by changing directions occasionally

= action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= process by which something like a cord or rope suddenly breaks in two

= piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibres, linen, or reeds; ► used for tying and keeping things together, climbing, measuring, drawing things to oneself, making traps, etc.; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to conditions that try to take control of people; a rope tied around the head is a symbol of submission
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= a round, deep dish or basin for the storage of liquids
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= artifact used as container, ◄ usually made of mud or ceramic, ► for different domestic purposes
= a place where water wells up from an underground source

= ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim, with a grooved rim around which a cord passes; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to raise and lower jars into a well

= hole in the ground, big enough to hold a person and deep enough that a person cannot climb out; ◄ usually dug out of the ground or hewn from rock; ► often used to collect and store rain water; ≈ fresh water from a spring is considered superior to stagnant water from a cistern

Node.gloss: dust returns to the earth|to pass away|to die
Node.definition: literally: dust returns to the earth; hence: = process by which humans die and their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which objects move back into the direction they came from
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which an event is performed to a larger extent than is normally done
= man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= to think about something in an effort to understand it well

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
= causative action by which humans arrange short passages of text in an orderly fashion so that it becomes a well organized text
= causative action by which animals, humans, or deities do whatever is necessary to perform a particular event
= man; ► author of biblical book of the same name (= Ecclesiastes); ◄ of uncertain meaning
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= state in which humans are morally and ethically right
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= iron tip of a goad (מַלְמַד)
= thin piece of metal (usually iron) sharpened on one end; ► used for attaching pieces of wood to each other or to the floor; ≈ associated with permanence and reliability

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= person engaged in a certain activity
meaning unsure; possibly: = things brought together for a common purpose
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= state in which an event is performed to a larger extent than is normally done

= process by which someone becomes aware of something (usually bad) that is going to happen, or something one should do to prevent something (usually bad) from happening; usually refers to a mediator making known what God has said or implied; ≈ wise people take these things seriously whereas foolish people ignore them
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
exact meaning unsure: = effort to increase one's knowledge by reading and meditating
= action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
